item.description:
We have posted these events in that past and our members that participated seemed to like them a lot.

While I am sure there are some men in our group that could benefit from a program like this - this one is just for the women.

Feel free to use this posting to coordinate travel and lodging with other randomites, but in order to register for this program you need to visit www.nhbow.com or call (603) 271-3212.

=====

REGISTER NOW FOR N.H. "BECOMING AN OUTDOORS-WOMAN" WINTER WORKSHOP

Come explore the skills you need to enjoy exciting winter outdoor activities at the New Hampshire Winter Becoming an Outdoors-Woman workshop set for Saturday, February 18, 2012, (snow date Sunday, February 19), at the Owl Brook Hunter Education Center in Holderness, N.H.

New Hampshire "Becoming an Outdoors-Woman" programs are co-sponsored by the New Hampshire Fish and Game Department and the New Hampshire Wildlife Federation.

 The program costs $55, which includes a box lunch. Participants must be at least 18 years old.

At this one-day workshop, participants select a single topic. Learn how to ice-fish; explore winter outdoor survival skills; try basic snowshoeing and tracking; snowmobiling; or "Shoe and Shoot" (snowshoeing and woodland target shooting).

Registration will open on January 9, 2012 - if you are interested, sign up when registration opens, because BOW workshops fill up fast!

A descriptive workshop brochure (not the registration form) is available now at http://www.nhbow.com.
item.name: Become an Outdoors Woman Winter Workshop
